newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Hyundai in Malta telecoms venture.
newsitem.headline: Hyundai in Malta telecoms venture.

text.p: South Korea's Hyundai Electronics Industries Co said on Tuesday it had agreed to participate in a three-way joint venture with an Italian and a Maltese firm to set up a telecommunications company in Malta.
A Hyundai statement said it would have a 29 percent stake in the joint venture Elsacom-Malta, which will be set up in Malta for telecommunications services in east European nations.
Hyundai Electronics is a unit of Hyundai Group.
Elsag Bailey SPA, part of Italy's Finmeccanica SPA, will hold a 51 percent stake and Malta's state-owned Telemalta the remaining 20 percent, the statement said.

Elsacom-Malta, to be capitalised at about $10 million, plans to launch in early 1997 satellite-relayed telephone and data communications services in Romania, Ukraine, Albania, Maldives, Bulgaria and former Yugoslavian region, it added.
